title: Clubs across Europe eyeing transfer of Liverpool's Emre Can with Reds playing hardball over new contract
text:
Sport Clubs across Europe eyeing transfer of Liverpool's Emre Can with Reds playing hardball over new contract Juventus and several sides back home are keen on German midfielder whose agent wants his current £35,000-a-week more than doubled Share An offer's been on the table for weeks as Can nears the final 12 months of his current deal (Photo: Getty) Share Get Liverpool FC   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Liverpool are ready to get tough with Emre Can if he continues to refuse a new contract. 
The Germany midfielder has been sitting on the offer a new deal since the turn of the year, but despite months of negotiations, is no closer to agreeing to extend his Anfield stay. 
And if he gets to the end of the season without a new deal, he will have just a year left on his current contract - leaving the Reds with little option but to cash in this summer on a player they signed for £10m three years ago. 
Can’s agent wants to more than double the 23-year-old’s current salary of around £35,000 a week. Striking a pose with Dejan Lovren at training on Tuesday (Photo: Liverpool FC) Read More James Milner laments inconsistency that has wrecked Liverpool's title hopes 
But Liverpool will refuse to pay over the odds for a player yet to fully convince the Kop faithful and establish himself as an automatic first-choice in the side Jurgen Klopp has built. 
The Reds boss is an admirer of Can and believes he can develop into a top class star, but the club believe his salary should reflect his position as a promising player, not the finished article. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
